website_summaries.verdict: Disposable trap utilizing powder attractant, activated by adding water.
pros: Simple to use: Just add water, and hang where needed inside or outside
Attractant lures insects to bag, where they are trapped
Kills up to 20,000 fruit flies as well as other "filth flies" per unit
No toxic chemicals, clean to use, and reasonably priced
cons: Bag trap itself is somewhat of an eyesore, and is intended not specifically for fruit flies

customer_reviews.title: HELL..IN A BAG
customer_reviews.text: Well, this works. A little too well. We knew we had a fly problem (thanks to new neighbors that have questionable horse care practices) But, WOW did we REALLY have a fly problem. The first day, this caught a few flies, but what happened over the following week was simply unbelievable. The more flies that got stuck in it, the more flies it seemed to attract. By day 4 there were so many flies that the entire bag was BLACK. My husband walked up and took a look and said.."That's pure Hell in a bag right there." We just hung a new one. Let the exorcism commence.
customer_reviews.author: KachinaDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all for me
customer_reviews.text: Our kitchen window is over the landing where the super stores the garbage, so we have a serious fly problem. I purchased three different products - the Rescue Fly Trap, the Catchmaster window strips and the Safer Victor Fly Magnet. I put the Safer and the Rescue hanging in the open window and the Catchmaster (2 strips) on the bottom windows pane. After a day I checked - the Rescue and Catchmaster had caught nothing - no one fly. The Safer Victor had over 40 flies in it! I know which one I'll be buying again - Safer all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Heldensop

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it! Terrible smell and more flies than before!
customer_reviews.text: The smell is awfull and it actually attracted more flies than before. Other thing is that it does not kill the flies, so the flies are alive inside the trap and they reproduced, so the bag and was full of flies and larvae. Although the flies cannot escape from the trap, the larvae did escape. SO, I had more flies than before and larveae everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Nirari C.

customer_reviews.title: Die fly die!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I could dream. We have a dog run and quite a bit of dog poop for 3 big mutts. I read reviews and wanted to try this. Wow 5 days in and bag is almost full. Smells like death
customer_reviews.author: Elwood K

customer_reviews.title: USELESS!!
customer_reviews.text: We had two areas (front and back entrance to house) that had an unusual amount of flies buzzing around. I bought two of these and put one up near each entrance where the flies were. I offer the following: 1. After 5 days there were 3 dead flies in one and 2 in the other. There were still many flies buzzing around. they landed on it, near it, around it and on top of it but seldom entered it. 2. The stench was awful. Visitors asked what the terrible smell was. 3. The traps went in the trash. Don't wast your money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Killed flys but stunk so bad it attracted even more flies than I had before
customer_reviews.text: STINKS! Stunk up my entire neighborhood. Killed flys but stunk so bad it attracted even more flies than I had before. Once I got rid of the trap the flies went away.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight  Schrute

customer_reviews.title: Will buy all summer!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! Almost work too well. Check pics to be disgusted and to see how it an actualy work too well........You should start out with the bigger bag. Like most have said you will not want to empty this thing and refill. I just wrapped mine in four plastic bags and discarded. Just like others have said it will really start to kick in on third day. The smell did not bother me unless I was 2-5 feet in front of this thing. You can definitely tell the difference in having some out and not having some out when it comes to flies.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Rock

customer_reviews.title: Don't use on a deck or patio!
customer_reviews.text: This product does work in catching flies (but also attracting them) and it is great that it is non-toxic and won't impact other garden creatures (like birds). The down-side for me is that it is very smelly (obviously to attract the flies), making it not a great option for any location near where you sit or linger. Not realizing this, I got this for our condo's back deck and the smell was very strong (like a porta-potty), and also drove our dog nuts (if he could've gotten to it, he would have). This is a good product for an area far from anywhere you are lingering, but not for a deck or patio.
customer_reviews.author: Knan

customer_reviews.title: Smells way to bad for city use!
customer_reviews.text: It works, it will attract flies from your entire neighborhood. Honestly, had more flies after installing with so many attracted to it. The bag was full and it stunk so bad I didn't know how to get rid of it. Hindsight I should have buried it several feet below. Put in garbage initially but then flies were all over the garbage can. Had to dispose of it in a remote location but not after stinking up myself and my vehicle and I felt nauseous after. Mine came in a pack of two but I won't be using the second.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rossow

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: This thing does attracts flies not only from your yard but from everyone’s yard!! Once there is a few flies in the bag.... be ready for a smell that can make you think there is a dead animal somewhere. I had one for one week. Omg! Stink!! I will never ever get this again! I put it the trash and had to pressure wash the trash container to get rid to the horrible smell. I think this product have crystallized poop that once mixed with the water it activates the poop smell. Ewwww. Horrible thing. I rather deal with a few flies in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: angelac

customer_reviews.title: Smells , but the flies Love it
customer_reviews.text: When it says a really stupid number of flies can be caught in this trap, they arent kidding. After two weeks the bag is more than half full of flies. it has a very distinct scent to it, so dont put it by your doors or open windows. We found that having it within 3 or 4 feet of the ground was more effective than having it higher up at 5 or 6 feet. we hung it out of sight behind some trees and it works amazing. Its really hot where we live so i added some water to it after the first week as it evaporated so fast and it kept working.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lamborn

customer_reviews.title: Best Fly Trap ever'
customer_reviews.text: Over the last 25 yrs I have used this product and have found it works great, as long as you keep it up high out of the way places like at a door way just out side, or when you go Camping they work just as well too. They get not only Fly's but just about anything else that fly's as well to that can fit in through the inlet for once they get in they can't get out.... and it's very easy to dump in to the trash can once it's full. Usually it doesn't take very long for the sack to fill up full of bug's.... This is the only one I buy now days...
customer_reviews.author: itsme24u2

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but may lead to messy clean up....
customer_reviews.text: The fly bag works well to capture flies, and it keeps my dog run area fly free. The problem I have with this bad is when it comes to disposal. The top of the fly bag does not have a way of closing and securing the fly bag for clean and safe disposal. I personally like the fly bags by Black Flag, they have a screw top, so when it's time to dispose of the bag, it's effortless, with little risk of the contents spilling. If you found this review helpful, please click the helpful button below.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo H

customer_reviews.title: These stink! (In a good way)
customer_reviews.text: This is the first year I've tried to fight flies. Normally we open our door on the South and the house is covered in them. This year I've only seen a few. The trap is hanging a few hundred feet from the house. The smell is very comparable to the rotting squirrel I found in the yard. I've only noticed it when we walk by, maybe 50' away if you are down wind. It is catching all kinds of flies. I'll be putting out a new one next year!
customer_reviews.author: GoneGolfin'

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Our patio became nearly a nightmare in the summer. Flies seemed to flock to us to the point where we were constantly swatting them away. I tried a few at-home DIY remedies but only managed to capture a few flies. After 2 days of use I've captured and killed HUNDREDS of flies with this inexpensive solution. Tip: - Hang above problematic areas like a garbage can - Hang the bag high out of the reach of any animals that might also be attracted to the smell Pros: - Insanely effective - Inexpensive - Easy to install Cons: - None, go buy some
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stewart Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worked before. Not so well this time. Could be expired or knock-off.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed... Ive used this twice in the past with great success. This time around, not so well. I have flies buzzing around the traps but they do not go into the trap. Much different experience from the last few times I’ve used it. Prior to this experience, the trap worked well. This experience, completely different. Cannot catch a single fly after using the product appropriately and following all the directions. Could be faulty product or an imitation received because the strong scent this normally produces to attract the flies is barely noticeable for this particular pair that I currently have.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD V DEJESUS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!  Works sooo fast!
customer_reviews.text: We had a serious infestation of flies near our patio after a wild turkey started visiting regularly and leaving droppings in the grass. I tried picking those up but it still didn’t do the trick once the infestation had taken hold. These fly traps are freaking amazing! Easy to use and worked like a charm within a few hours. Within 2 to 3 days, there were already nearly 100 flies in the trap. Will definitely buy again! I wish somebody made a mosquito trap that worked this well. I hate killing anything, including insects, but this fly population had become a nuisance. So happy to be rid of these pesky bugs!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Ryman

customer_reviews.title: No Flies and No people due to HORRIFIC SMELL
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions and upon adding water I immediately smelled a horrific odor coming from the bag. I was thinking hurry get outside and hang. I thought I was going to vomit from the odor. It was worse than old trash from a dumpster. My husband hung and there was a nice breeze and we sat down and had to quickly leave the area due to the horrific odor. I ordered 2 so I went and reread the directions. We quickly removed it and threw in the trash and hauled it off. It was crazy how awful the smell was. Never buy this product!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie lagow

customer_reviews.title: writing titles is the hardest part of a review
customer_reviews.text: I had a bad fly infestation last year (some trash didn't get picked up for a few weeks) and ordered a few of these and boy did they work, the bags were overflowing with flies. Had a few flies this year, and it kinda works when there really isn't a big problem, as there aren't that many flies in the bag, but still have a few flies trying to bother me when I eat outside. Overall, I like them and recommend them, but won't necessarily get rid of every single fly. Also the smell from the bag doesn't seem as bad this year, so maybe that's why I still have a few random flies.
customer_reviews.author: TitleWriter

customer_reviews.title: Smells terrible when you add the water, but damn this works great!
customer_reviews.text: This product is by far the most disgusting and best working flytrap I could ever have found. It smells pretty bad so don't keep it in an enclosed area make sure that it is outside and away from any doorway. It will begin working immediately and by the smell you'll know. In less than a week I had a bag full of dead flies, I guess the only problem you might run into is that it goes from a bag of flies to a bag of maggots... It becomes an interesting study in biology or nightmare fuel. Either way it works at keeping the flies interested in the bag rather than the inside of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Flores Family

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting but works
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the grossest things ever but it works! I've had a problem with having the lawn attract a ton of flies. Every time I open the front door even for a second, I'll get an average of 2 flies coming in. It's annoying. I set this up about 15 feet from my front door and in a week it's probably captured 200 flies. 15 feet keeps the smell away because if you smell it too closely, you'll want to throw up. Also, looking into the bag at a sea of dead flies is definitely not recommended if you can avoid it. While this thing doesn't prevent flies, it does help draw them away. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kim

customer_reviews.title: I loved this!!  (But spouse didn't.)
customer_reviews.text: This thing catches a truly incredible number of flies. Now, I could barely smell it, but my husband began complaining of a horrible smell in the yard which we finally realized was the trap. (If we'd had quite a large yard, maybe we could have put it well away from the area where we sit outdoors.) I suspect the scent attracts flies from other yards, too, which may explain the way it fills up, in an almost surreal way, even though our fly problem was mild. Anyhow I was a little sad to say goodbye to such an effective product, but I did it to avoid family discord !
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot Belle

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out for the Smell!
customer_reviews.text: Put these FAR away from high traffic areas. These easy to use traps certainly attracted and trapped lots of flies when we first placed them on either side of our outdoor patio. WRONG MOVE. The odor of these traps made sitting outside just as unpleasant as the flies did initially. Set up is simple and can be done easily by anyone. After about 3 days maggots were noticeable inside the trap and after that the whole process seemed like a wash. The flies are not killed but just trapped inside. There were just as many outside of and around the trap as inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: They stink but they WORK!
customer_reviews.text: The flies were unbelievable this year. We could hear them nailing our glass door. Once we installed these, that stopped and we saw less and less over the course of 1-2 weeks. The bags will hold a TON of flies too. Beware though, don't put them near windows or doors or you will not be happy with the smell. At least 30+ feet away is a good rule of thumb. When the bag starts to look full or after 30 days, whichever comes later, carefully place the bag in two garbage bags and place upright in your garbage can. Otherwise you will be in for a real treat when you open that can again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective at attracting/trapping annoying flies
customer_reviews.text: The trap is surprisingly easy to use and surprisingly, it continues to attract even when the trap is near full capacity. The trap does begin to give off a distasteful scent once you get into the 2nd+ week but that's limited to around a 2-3 foot radius. I ultimately decided to use gallon Ziplock bags when it came to removing the trap bag for discard. The trap bag easily fits into the gallon Ziplock so you can just open the Ziplock bag to full opening and slide it over the trap and seal. That traps the scent and makes it a lot more tolerable when discarding.
customer_reviews.author: ddev

customer_reviews.title: they fly in then they fly out
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed that we sat through the stink coming from the trap only to watch the flies crawl back out. Every fly that entered, while we watched, actually crawled back out after a few laps around the opening! After a full day, we only counted 1 or 2 flies floating in the stinky juice. EDIT: I guess it was the weather. THEY CATCH TONS OF FLYS! Some may crawl out, but those that do are only a fraction compared to what stays in. We keep them downwind and to the side. They're causing damage to the fly population for sure.
customer_reviews.author: bingbangboom

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the negative reviews are about, I'm not trying to be mean but I don't know if they understand how to follow directions or not or what in the world! These things are amazing! I have three strategically placed in my backyard and they are basically full! I had a barbecue a couple of weeks ago and the flies were at the bags and not the food! Seriously do not listen to the negative reviews because they're doing something wrong, or they have special flies or something like that I have no idea! These are worth every penny and I get them every year!
customer_reviews.author: jamie Schindeldecker

customer_reviews.title: This thing WORKS !!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a weeeeeee bit skeptical but bought it because of the other reviews. All I have to say is, OH MY GOODNESS !!! These traps really work, the bag caught I think the entire neighborhood flies in a little over a week. Kinda gross and smelly. But flies aren't a big issue now. I still have one bag and might use it but I think the one did the job. Word of caution, handle the filled bag carefully, the last thing you want is fly goo all over you. These things really reek with an odor that will make you want to puke. But once you toss it in a hazmat bag, your good :)
customer_reviews.author: Johnny E

customer_reviews.title: Rotting flesh all over the place
customer_reviews.text: Do you love the smell of rotting flesh? Do you want that smell all over your house? If so, then this is the product for you! Both items had holes in the bags out of the box. Unfortunately, we only discovered that after filling the bag per instruction. This resulted in the putrid smelling bait to leak all over our floor. When your spouse is pregnant with morning sickness, that isn’t something that is kindly received. All told, this product is terrible. Both units went in the trash before they could ever be used for their indented purpose. I would rather suffer thousands of flies than ever use this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: it workd very very well
customer_reviews.text: got this and put it near my chicken coop and compost bins which didn't have flies as I just built it. this trap attracted so many flies that they were fighting to get into it. it was full the very next day. IT STINKS so bad I had to move it to the furthest corner of the yard thinking is it will attract flies there. I moved it twice as the wind kept blowing the nasty smell our way. I also hung up some sticky flypaper that doesn't smell near the patio and compost bin. I would recommend this but seriously the smell is nasty. It will attract flies from near and far,
customer_reviews.author: Tiffy

customer_reviews.title: My GOD does this thing stink but IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Initially though that this was not working but it takes a couple days before it really starts attracting flies. Man did they come looking for the bag of smelly stuff! This works . Word of caution; move it away from where you will be spending most of your time because I don't know what they put in this bag but it stinks like the grinch's underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Kahlil Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: You have to cut the plastic bag... The bag that is the container... so do not mess that up. My first bag was not sealed properly on the bottom. My idiot self thought I must have gotten water on the outside while trying to hang it. Nope. Covered in stinky stuff and an empty bag. O well manufactured mistakes happen. On to the second bag. I hang it and wait. Fully expected flies to get trapped and die...... 2 days later and its horribly putrid and 5 flies.... 5 FLIES. I have more crawling on my legs then in this dang trap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Marshall

customer_reviews.title: SMELL HORRIBLE, WORK GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This trap is awesome. The flies try to get in while you are hanging it. Make sure to put it far away from where you sit outside, and think of your neighbors too. I place mine back in the far part of my yard and it pulls the flies back there and away from our patio. Its very gross to get rid of, so not for the squeamish. It smells like rotting meat, and it gets worse as the dead/dying flies accumulate. But it work really really well. I find 2-3 a summer does the trick. I didn't post a picture because....like I said, its gross. But Seriously, THESE ARE AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: stormygrl0804

customer_reviews.title: The Flys Love It
customer_reviews.text: It really stinks, so don't put it too near an outside seating area. Mine is in a tree out back, maybe 25-30 feet from my back door. The weather changed a bit, and today is the first day I haven't seen flies surrounding and flying inside the bag. There are a lot of dead flies in the pictured bag. Before putting the bag up, we had a lot of flies on the back porch and venturing into the house when the door was opened. We've seen very few in the house after putting the bag out. We've used these bags before and knew they worked.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: The good-This product works are described. Was trapping and killing flies within minutes. Within a couple days there were hundreds, after 2 weeks was still working. The bad-The smell (stench) gets worse and worse, after a couple weeks can smell it from 15 feet away. Disposing of this was difficult. Smell made me wretch, have to triple bag this thing and get it right on the garbage truck. Spilled a few drops and every fly in neighborhood came for a visit. Would recommend as it diverted attention of flies away from me whilst sitting on patio. Need a very strong constitution to get rid of it though. Scared to use 2nd one from package!
customer_reviews.author: M. McCarron

customer_reviews.title: Saw results within a few hours.
customer_reviews.text: Hung it from our tree in our backyard at 12pm. I went to check it at 3pm and there were already approx 50 flies trapped inside. Can’t wait to see what it will look like in 24hours. The smell isn’t as bad as I thought it would be. Our patio table in our backyard is less than 100feet away from where I hung the trap and we can’t smell anything. Maybe the smell gets worse as the days pass... we’ll find out.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ballesteros

customer_reviews.title: Flies don't stand a chance
customer_reviews.text: Very disgusting, but very satisfying to see this bag filled up in just a few days with the remains of thousands of dead flies. All of our neighbors own dogs, including us. Flies are a constant nuisance. I put two of these up, and there are hardly any flies around us anymore. This works well. I will continue to purchase these and keep them up around our garbage area outside and also around the corner from our patios hung up on a tree. They work for a month or so, but it's filled it up with dead flies in a couple of weeks during the summer. I'll be replacing it every 2-3 weeks in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. Milks

customer_reviews.title: Rancid Bait Odor - Over Attracts Flies Causing a Bigger Problem
customer_reviews.text: We had a couple of flies that hung around our back patio and also on our porch that we wanted to keep away. We hung one trap in each area. By the next day we had so many flies buzzing all over the porch and patio. It was miserable. The bait smell is so rancid it smells like rotted trash (or a decomposing animal). One of the traps had a small hole that was undetectable but by morning the rancid bait had leaked onto the patio and it was a mess! Yeah, it attracts flies but it attracts way more flies than you originally have creating a bigger problem AND the bait smell will make you want to vomit.
customer_reviews.author: BakeretteJen

customer_reviews.title: No More Flies
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start with this? I purchased this in hopes of reducing the amount of flies that like to hang out near our home. Simply put, THESE WORK! Set up took minutes and I kid you not, within an hour of hanging one up, there were 10 flies in the bag! An hour later, a dozen more. The next day, over 50. You get the point. These do their job and they do it well. I noticed some reviews mentioned an odor and I’m currently four days in with the same bag and I haven’t noticed a scent, yet. While these aren’t very aesthetically pleasing they do what they’re supposed to do, no doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: WOW! THIS WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: These fly bags work! We had a ton of flies and now we have a ton of dead flies. The smell is awful so put the fly bag away from you door or anywhere where you can smell the death in the bag. I now have a lot of dead flies and maggots in the bag. So gross, but so good at the same time. I continue to add water to the bag as it is getting more full of flies. I've had this for approximately one month and the flies are still going toward the bag. Once they are in, they can not get out. If you have flies, get this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jane E.

customer_reviews.title: 1 in this 2-pack arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered these fly traps consistently for the past 3 years. The smell is not the most pleasant, but generally "worth it" because they really do a fantastic job of rounding up the huge flies that would otherwise take over my backyard patio during the summertime. Unfortunately, this order was a big disappointment because 1 of the 2 fly traps arrived damaged! There is a hole in it, and as soon as I poured the water in, the yeasty/water mess started spilling out everywhere. Smelly, gross, and frustrating to have paid for 2 and only gotten use of 1.
customer_reviews.author: Dana McGill

customer_reviews.title: It works but BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: It works - but too good.... I bought these to take care of the flies in my yard however this product has created more flies in my yard because every fly in a mile radius is interested in them. There are flies surrounding it all day and night flying all around everywhere. I’m really upset by this because not only do they smell awful, I’m scared to touch them and take them down because it’s live fly city inside and around them each of them no joke. I feel like the flies will still stick around my yard even after I get rid of the traps.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This item absolutely works and works well!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, except these items exceeded my expectation! They absolutely work, without a doubt. I suggest that you put them approximately 50-100 ft away from where you will be utilizing the space. The flies will be attracted to the unpleasant sent that these bags give off and within hours you will see them start to fill up with flies and other flying pests. I can now sit on my patio and actually drink my coffee without several pesky flies landing on the rim of my cup, causing me to no longer care to drink it. This is a definite high recommendation item if you have a fly issue. Exterior use only I think. 👍😁👍
customer_reviews.author: Kyni Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We just put it outside a couple hours ago in our backyard and there’s so many dead flies in it! We placed it at a little distance from our home we can’t smell it but it still allures the flies by the house and killed them! It’s our first time buying something like this. Easy to use and was able to set it up no problem. Glad it comes in a pack of two. Material is good quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Great fly catcher
customer_reviews.text: Ok, they do have some odor, but I hang mine out by the chicken house where the smell doesn’t matter. These things really do catch flies, hundreds and hundreds of them per bag. The flies can’t escape, so the bodies pile up inside until the bag is full. I hang the full bags in a tree somewhere until any remaining liquid evaporates, and then I cut the bag open and feed the dead flies to the chickens. I wish they were a little less expensive, but I appreciate their safety, ease of use, and effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Vulture

customer_reviews.title: May work too well..
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 of these traps [not at same time]all placed at same location in less than 2months. It drew alot of flies, yellow jackets and wasps and caught quite a bit of flies.Problem is they never stop coming. Not sure if they are laying eggs to reproduce that quickly or others coming from miles around..seems like never ending problem. I dont let it fill up to top.of dead flies. Disposing of it is a total nightmare. Put in 2 grocery bags and tied knot. Smell in garbage can was still unbearable. Then flies attracted to garbage can!
customer_reviews.author: Dominick42

customer_reviews.title: stinky
customer_reviews.text: So I actually bought this by accident, I meant to buy the wasp catch instead. I decided to go ahead and use the product since I paid for it. I followed the instructions by filling the bag with water and the inner bait would dissolve. Whoooow does this stuff stink. It smells like rotten road kill, you really can't put it any where that humans are around, it needs to be far from the house. I hung it in a tree at the furthest part of our back yard and I'm hesitant to go check on it to see if it works, lol. With the smell of it, I'm assuming the flies will love it!
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Stinks but that's why it works.
customer_reviews.text: After a few days, this trap stinks to high heaven. It draws flies pretty far away. I bought this product because when grilling, have flies around that make a real pest of themselves. At first, put about 20 feet away from the grill and between the grill and garbage can. After seeing how many flies it draws and how far, ,moved to about 30 feet away. First bag is almost full and hasn't been a week yet. I urge you to order the large bag the first time, cause they fill up fast. (or at least mine did)
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: FLY SLAYER!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is exactly as advertised. It came in and I immediately set it up. Nothing to it, just open it up and add water. I hung it outside my garage and in an hour flies were all trapped inside. I’m into day two and I’m just waylaying on the next generation of flies!!! With it being right outside our garage I thought maybe the scent would be to much but I haven’t noticed it until I go up close to see how many flies at dead in there. If you have a fly problem this is a must!!
customer_reviews.author: CLIFF

customer_reviews.title: This product helps me help the world get rid of a bunch of unwanted flies. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product was so easy to use. And caught soooooooo many flies it was incredible and disgusting. It’s smell like a dead carcass of some sort that stinks to high heaven. But I think that’s just the nature of the beast. If I were having guests in the outdoor patio I’d move it far far away so not to insult my guests with the smell. I’m sure I’d still catch a bunch of the countless flies that are roaming around outside. They are actually attracted to that stuff inside that lures them into the trap.
customer_reviews.author: M A

customer_reviews.title: Has done a good job of controlling flys around my back porch
customer_reviews.text: The product works as you see the volume of flies you catch. I find I'm replacing it every month as the fluid in the bag drys up more than it fills up with flies. However, this might be a characteristic of AZ temperatures and low humidity. The contents have a barnyard like smell, but I only occasionally notice it based upon the direction of the wind. I only use one to cover the entire back-porch area. No complaints on my part and little annoyance. I will continue to purchase the product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Owen

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The app turned the picture sideways; however, it still tells the story. I put 5 stars on the scent bc it's doing an outstanding job attracting the flies. (In other words, it's doing its job.) The scent is rank to humans, so put it downwind from you but decently close to where the flies are a nuisance. The bag looks black bc of the # of dead flies. It's only been up 6 days and will last a good while longer. We have another we will take camping. This makes our meals so much better without swatting at flies the whole time. Highly recommend and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: The idea of the product is to create a scent that attracts flies, captures them and they die. The smell is pretty bad, but flies are attracted to death, so if you don't mind the smell, that's not a negative. As far as trapping is concerned, after a week or so, there are flies trapped. Unfortunately, there are more flies that are flying around the area STILL that easily ignore the trap. That being said, it's not effective. I will be looking for other products or possible a bug zapper light of some sort.
customer_reviews.author: golfguy

customer_reviews.title: Bait attracts more flies
customer_reviews.text: Although these are very effective at trapping and killing flies, they’re also effective at attracting them. We had a fly problem on our patio — installed these and were very pleased with the results. Over the next few day’s more flies kept showing up... they were everywhere. We knew the bait is super smelly because we could smell it when the wind blew. Then we had a thought, is the bait just attracting more flies? The answer is yes! After removing the traps, the flies went away in about 6 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: smelled like something died
customer_reviews.text: it was easy enough to put up but after a day or two it smelled like something had died in the yard kept looking everywhere. the smell kept get worse, not thinking it was the fly trap. when i realized i had been looking on the ground the whole time a week later it was then i found out it was the hanging fly trap. it was so bad i really thought something large had died almost threw up trying to get it down and throw it out. never again. only collected a few flies, not enough to justify that horrible stench.
customer_reviews.author: ChaseW

customer_reviews.title: Catches lots of flies, smells like a dead animal
customer_reviews.text: I live in a very warm climate. After a week of use, one of the two traps I put out has caught lots of flies, and also has a strong odor. Unless you're upwind of it, it needs to be at least 30 ft away (preferably more) or you're likely to notice the smell. Update: It's been about 2 or three weeks now, and both traps smell like dead animals. I'm definitely going to have to move at least one of them to the very back of the backyard, and am not looking forward to it. Don't put these anywhere near your house or upwind of any neighbors you don't hate.
customer_reviews.author: usefulcat

customer_reviews.title: Works but stinks badly
customer_reviews.text: I took the risk after reading review, hoping that the smell won't be an issue. But it really is pretty bad. It might be fine if you use far away from where you spend any time, or if you have no sense of smell. But in a back yard, you can't miss the stench within a 50 feet radious, or even more depending on the heat and the wind. It did catch some flies, not as many as I expected, but I think population was already lower by the time I placed the traps. For a back yard, I would not use it again, unless as a temporary fix for a really bad infestation.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this would work because it seemed so basic but OMG! I can't believe how many flies it's caught. I have feral/free-roaming cats who eat on my deck and the flies were awful. The poor cats had to keep running away because the flies were bothering them. Now the flies are so attracted to this they don't bother the cats. I think It's attracted flies from miles away! I've had it hung for a week and it's almost full. So gross! My only question is--how do you dispose of it?
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Welker

customer_reviews.title: These traps work!
customer_reviews.text: This type of fly trap is very effective. I hung mine using some fishing line (that's one thing you have to supply, a means to hang the trap. I also used buttonhole twist thread doubled to hang one) Within 1 hour, there were at least 20 flies in the trap. Each day, the numbers multiply. I was having a terrible problem with maggots in my trash bins. I hung one near my bin location and it has been working great. No maggots, so no flies. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anjella

customer_reviews.title: The scent is strong and unpleasant, but the trap is very effective
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to setup. Very good product design. My biggest issue is that the scent can be worse than the flies especially at first. It did trap a ton of flies, and continues to work through the summer. It was kind of funny because eventually a few spiders caught on that flies were attracted to the trap so they got in on the act and sort of hung around the trap hoping for a quick meal. I'm debating on whether to use this next summer only because the scent was a bit much in the backyard. Probably works better if you hang it farther away from where people hang out.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R.

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrid, but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with a lot of other reviews. These bags once activated smell like death. Do not put them near a porch or where people might sit. I hung mine up last night in my dog’s run area and woke up today to see both bags full of flies. I do also agree, these bags attract flies big time! But, it has helped with little nasty bugs. Overall, satisfied with this product. But again be warned it smells bad and seems to attract more flies into the area you hang it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C Bando

customer_reviews.title: Insanely disgusting...surprisingly effective
customer_reviews.text: Ok, at first, we just loved these things, they captured hundreds, if not thousands, of flies...but then it seemed that we just had to keep putting a new one out within a matter of days, and I started to wonder if we weren't attracting flies to our property instead of getting rid of them...and the stink, OMG, so disgusting, I cannot even describe it. Basically, it's effective, but to what end? the flies still just kept coming back and we simply couldn't keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Teeball

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: was very skeptical at first about the smell, catching of flying in a bag etc but boy was i wrong. there is a little smell but i placed it outside in my yard near my turf where my dog uses and boy has this thing been catching flies. now i do not know if it attracts flies as there are obviously still flys flying around but it is catching at least 20 flies a day and its oddly satisfying seeing them caught inside this little trap. love it and will definitely be recommending to anyone in need for a fly trap!
customer_reviews.author: Arash

customer_reviews.title: Attracts and traps hundreds of flies
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fly catcher. Fill the bag half way with water and hang it at least 50 feet away from your patio as the the smell from the fly trap is awful but definitely attracts countless number of flies. During the summer I replace the flytrap bag every week because it is full with hundreds of flies. When disposing of the trap, make sure you close the top of the fly trap with duct tape to prevent them or the water from spilling out in the trash bag. Been buying this for years and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great, natural product that works.
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into a house and the three bushes leading up to the front door were filled with 100s of flies. They were all different sizes and species. I thought something was dead in the bushes, but I never found anything. I didn’t want to spay chemicals because I have young kids and a dog. I bought the fly bag and hung it up just behind the bushes. Everyday the fly population was cut in half. It was amazing on how well this product worked. It’s not all great, the bait stinks. However, it only smell it within 10ft and the wind has to be just right. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A. Riccardi

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made now
customer_reviews.text: SO MAD! These were wonderful, and I order a whole batch this year. All but one of the packs was not sealed at the bottom, leaking stunk everywhere, which my dog promptly licked up and off to vet we went. I tried gorilla tape, waterproof, to seal the bottoms before filling the last few and they were still a lost cause because they were not sealed in other spots. I ha e recommended these to friends but no more. Shoddy machinery and quality testing.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple of these for my yard. Every spring, my Los Angeles backyard becomes fly central, and it makes entertaining a gross nightmare. I bought two of these and boy oh boy, for the first time in five years of living here all of a sudden outdoor entertaining is almost fly-free! I am very sensitive to smells and I don’t notice the smell of this at all. In fact, I had some seating near one trap and I don’t think it bothered my guests at all. UPDATE: these worked better than anything else I’ve ever bought. I tossed these (full of flies) and bought two more. Lasted two months, I just kept adding more water.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Dog of Action

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Smell awful...install away from people extremely effective..in a while the bag was full of dead flies! my yard was infested of flies by my neighbor problem (They apologized for it...I think they disposed dead squirrels in the trash can!) I highly recommended I installed one close to my trash can and it was full of dead flies in a short time.Easy to dispose...gross though! again stay away from the smell that it is use to attract flies ! again highly recommended ! . I have an extra two of them to be used in summer time !
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!  The flies go in and can't get out.
customer_reviews.text: You are going to want to hand these far enough away so you can't smell it. You can smell the bag 10 feet away down wind of it. We actually had a Turkey Vulture buzz past the area with the Fly Trap, I think it was looking for what was dead. The bag was buzzing with flies a day after hanging. I could not believe how many. I do feel we had far fewer flies while out on our deck than previous years. I think the ones I've seen just haven't found the bag yet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Put one of these up right after it arrived, and it was immediately covered and filled with flies. I was shocked at how quickly they were drawn to it. I feel like it was drawing flies from all over the neighborhood, which while initially disturbing, they seemed to mostly ignore us and go right to the bag. We didn't notice a smell initially, but after the first day, it was pretty smelly. You definitely don't want this near your living area. Will definitely be purchasing these moving forward to help control flies.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walker

customer_reviews.title: This bags are exciting!
customer_reviews.text: I am so so so happy with this trap! I go and see the bag so often; more flies are caught every time I checked. I power washed and am maintaining the patio clean, but many flies still come and land on my children's bikes and toys. My husband and I were fed up and purchased these bags. So many flies go inside the bag. I strongly recommend this trap!! It is fun to see.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRODUCT ! ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: OK.... This year the fly population has been unbearable ! I ordered this product, not really knowing how well or if it would work. WOW ! [ Be sure to read the instructions BEFORE you start setting up the bag, trap, and solution ! ] When you've got the bag and contents ready, suspend the bag in a location where there are a lot of flies. Within hours we had flies buzzing all around the bag, and once they're in the bag.... they're never going to get out. Its fascinating to watch the process ! And fantastic that we're finally getting rid of all those darn flies ! ! ! !
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne H.

customer_reviews.title: Need seller to contact me
customer_reviews.text: I buy these locally at Home Depot for around $4 each and they have worked all summer. So I figured I would buy this quantity from Amazon to save some money. Bad mistake! These came in from China with a little packet of red granules that basically have such a low odor that it is not even drawing the flies in. I have killed thousands of flies with the ones I bought locally from Home Depot. Not one flight has landed in any of the four traps in my backyard right now. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells Terrible, but Works Great
customer_reviews.text: These have always worked great. First one caught at least 400 flies in about 24 hours, no lie. And it didn't look like we had that many in our yard. We tossed that one and put up another and got about 100 flies after a couple days, so they help a lot. We will keep using these to keep the flies to a minimum. In the past we have found that you only need to hang them up a couple of times through the summer to keep the population down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not as durable
customer_reviews.text: Right away it went to work catching flies. The scent was strong and they just flew straight to it. The first day it caught about 30, the second day 20 and the rest of the week it just sat there. Definitely effectively but the scent goes away fast. I don't have many flies so I can't really say that it doesn't work but I don't see it being effective for 30 days. One thing I made sure was to keep it away from possible dripping or spilling hazards because I couldn't verify if it's pet safe. Some reviewers said it is - I just didn't want to take a chance. Yes I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DI

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: We have so many flies this year because of our monsoon rain. I saw one of these bags hanging on a neighbor's back patio. I immediately purchased. As soon as it arrived I followed the instructions to hang. It doesn't come with anything to hang it with. I used pipe cleaners (lol). Within 30 minutes of hanging there were dozens of flies trapped in the bag. It's pretty gross, but also fascinating how many it catches. I didnt know there were that many out there to catch. I need to hang the second on the other side of the yard. I have noticed fewer flies making their way into the house.
customer_reviews.author: teachteacha

customer_reviews.title: Works so well it backfires
customer_reviews.text: First: it works ... they are packed with the nasty flyers in there and it's gross. But seriously it works SO well I believe it attracts even more flies to my yard which is the complete opposite goal. I keep seeing more and more flies zooming around these, so I guess I'm helping the neighborhood. Second: it stinks HORRIBLY. Put it as far away from your house as possible (which again defeats the need to trap flies close to the house to prevent them from coming in). If you have a small yard, far away is not far enough. I will be looking for a more passive trap.
customer_reviews.author: S. R.

customer_reviews.title: OMFG it smells so bad
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot to drink last night and I'm VERY hungover...as soon as I filled the bag to the fill line, I got a whiff of the poison inside the bag and nearly puked!...keep this thing at least 25 ft away from your house and don't put it up if your hungover lol...this trap works! 20 minutes after I hung it up there were around 10 nasty flies trapped inside waiting to die, I couldn't help but smile knowing that those annoying little fukz weren't gonna be buzzing my head as soon as I walk out to my deck anymore! I'm ordering 20 more to kill every fly on my 2 acres
customer_reviews.author: Cattivo

customer_reviews.title: Not for Spotted lantern Flys!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for regular flys, but not spotted lantern flys. I got this because I saw a photo that looked like it was a bag full of the lantern fly. I don’t live around too many reg flys, but I think every fly in the neighborhood came to that bag, but not one spotted lantern fly. If you have a reg fly problem, than this is the bag for you. It does smell bad, but boy does it catch regular flys!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: These bags work!
customer_reviews.text: We’re not sure why but we have a lot of flies. Maybe something was dead in the woods behind the house but really were a pain while having dinner on the deck and then getting into the house. I hung two of these in a nearby tree and wow! They love it and fly in and can’t get out. There must be a couple hundred in each. Recommend that you hang these at least 20 feet away (downwind is preferable) because the bait stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Smells like fresh poo, literally.
customer_reviews.text: OMG, these STINK to high heaven. I know they ate supposed to have a scent to attract flies, but I'm pretty sure it's s**t scented. It stunk up our porch for over a week before we couldn't take it anymore and had to get rid of it. That being said, it does work and filled up with flies. In fact I'm pretty sure we were attracting flies from the whole neighborhood over to our yard. You just have to decide if having your porch smell like fresh dirty diapers is worth the price of getting rid of the flies.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wilhite

customer_reviews.title: Stinks and Didn't work for San Diego patio flies
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I have different fly's than this one traps but nothing went into it. It smells up the patio and I live in San Diego so we don't get tons of bugs but a new patio had a group of about seven to ten fly's buzzing in the shade. I set this up right in the middle of the group but not one of them went inside. Weird. They don't fly into my house but spin in a circle on the patio with no food in sight. Anyway don't recommend for San Diego patio flies.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle F.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on the fly population
customer_reviews.text: I hate flies. These bags catch the flies so that I can enjoy my yard and reduces the number of flies that get into the house. At first the bag wasn’t attracting the flies after I hung it outside. I could see that the water was just sitting on the stuff in the bag. I took my hand and juggled the outside of the bag to mix it up and that activated that nasty smell that the flies love. I now have a bag full of flies and more waiting to get in. It is gross but it cuts down on the problem. Other than the smell they word well. I hang it in the far back of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: vagma

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: If your goal is simply to kill flies, then this works just fine. If you’re trying to shoo the flies away from a picnic, not so much. The bait truly reeks to high heaven. My wife made me move it further from the house than it already was. This killed flies in a short amount of time, but the smell brings more into the neighborhood. Then, when the eggs hatch, the maggots crawling all over the trap (thankfully, they did not escape) is something from a horror movie. Like I said, if all you want to do is kill ‘em, this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: The Giant Skunk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fly trap
customer_reviews.text: We love these fly traps!! I have one by our front door hanging off the porch and one hanging off our deck...no flies trying to come in the house anymore and can sit on our deck without any flies bothering us or the kids (gets the gnats too!). Every so often, you get a wift of a bad smell...that's why I gave the scent a 1 star lol. I'm thinking the sent is what attracts the flies though. We replace the one in hanging in front once a month but so many flies in the back so replacing it probably twice a month. It takes a day or two after hanging for you to notice a difference. Great product!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle

customer_reviews.title: Fly Trap
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It smells awful, but that is why it works so well. I have purchased in the past but this order with the first fly trap must have had a weak seal at the bottom because it leaked all the fluid out and although it had a lot of flies, the previous traps never broke no matter how full it was. I still have one more of the 2 pack because I was so disappointed that I have not used the second one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Rotten
customer_reviews.text: If you can stand the rotten smell, then they work good, So good they will attract more flies then you have ever seen in your life. This was intended for use on my back patio to keep flies from coming in my back door.. They smell so bad. I had to move them to the back 40.. Good for a ranch or farm.. But, I will not buy them again for in town use.. I want rid of flies, not a rotten smell of a dead carcass with thousands of flies swarming..
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out on this one
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Does what it says!!!however the plan was to keep flies away from the house. It actually drew them to my house and when I say “them” I mean every flying insect in the ENTIRE neighborhood. From wasp to bees. The bag was filled to the top within two days. The smell is horrible. It defeats the purpose of keeping them near your trash can to keep them away. Put the bag at a neighbors house that you don’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Sherl

customer_reviews.title: Lord of the flies...
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea where all the dang flies are coming from in my back sun room area, but it's gross! I tried some f the 'sticky tape' fly bait and not one single fly has landed on it. As soon as I hung this product out by the window it was FULL! I'll need to replace it with the second one shortly, and most likely I will order more. It's amazing! Do not use inside...they stink, but I guess that's what flies like!
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: A Flys Worst Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: We live surrounded by cattle and horses and the flys are horrible. These work! They do smell, but that is what attracts the flys and why they are for outdoor use. We have used these for two summers now and we have nothing but positive feedback. Recommend you replace them more frequently if you have a serious fly problem. This year we are changing them out every 2 weeks because of how quickly they fill up. Last year we only changed them about every 5-6 weeks. I hate flys and this product helps me keep them out of my house!
customer_reviews.author: Snsmom

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Way better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I honestly cant't believe how well this fly trap worked. I purchased this because the flies in my back yard have been bothersome. We don't usually get flies but this year was bad and I couldn't find the cause. I HATE flies so I decided to hand a single fly trap. After just a few minutes I could see the flies climbing into the trap. After a day, I saw a ton of flies floating in the water. The photos I attached are after just TWO DAYS with this fly trap. I honestly couldn't believe how many flies it caught. This is a great product and definitely one I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: PeacockBlue11

customer_reviews.title: They work, place them higher than your kid can reach
customer_reviews.text: Well they sure fill up with flies fast. I have noticed less in my house this year. But don't place them downwind from anywhere you want to be, they smell terrible! It must be why they work so well. My son poured some of the liquid on his head. A 30 minute shower later, he was clean and no longer crying. But man we had to throw his clothes out. He is now no longer scared of taking showers, so thanks I guess fly trap.
customer_reviews.author: Polity the Shark

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! These things are horrible. They bring MORE flies then you had before. They smell so bad. I know that’s what makes the flies go into them but it’s so bad. The smell is strong! I had to throw them out after 1 week. I had one in the front yard and one in the back yard and we got swarmed with flies. I DONT recommend these at all. Also went to a patio restaurant and they had these too. There were so many flies we had to get our food to go.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Ok at best
customer_reviews.text: These traps are ~ok at best. Catch some flies - yes, catch 20k flies as some review suggested...nowhere near. We have two (from two separate stocks / suppliers) within ~10' of each other near our barn stall (now for 3 weeks). Our two equine continue to have numerous flies and there are plenty of flies on areas (stall doors/walls etc) near the traps. Unfortunately no - not even remotely a 'silver bullet' for fly control.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Worst product
customer_reviews.text: First, it smells like FRESH HUMAN POOP, and very very very STRONG. if you put it far away from your house, it will go to next to your neighbors (???). Otherwise, you cann't suffer that smell which could be effected to your health. When I got in touch it, I washed my hand with soap 2 times + 1 time with lemon + 1 time for bath, smell still stick with me (OMG). Remember, smell likes "FRESH HUMAN POOP", and very very very STRONG. How it works? For me, it wasted time, money, and your work to clean it up.
customer_reviews.author: T.Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great for larger properties
customer_reviews.text: I live in a row home in Northeast Philadelphia. I purchased this because it seemed like a good idea to rid our outdoor trash area of flies. I hung the fly trap over my garage door. Within hours, the bag was buzzing with about 400 flies. By 7pm of the same night, that number doubled. Unfortunately, I also had more flies in my home because of the trap. It works very well, but I believe it works better for homes that have a larger land area so the trap can draw the flies away from the home.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well as some of the other brands
customer_reviews.text: The plus is that it is very easy to use. It stinks but they all do so that's expected. However, it doesn't attract flies as well as I had hoped. With other brands, they seem to draw the flies away from garbage cans and they are all huddled around the opening trying to get inside. That wasn't the case with this brand. Although it did attract flies, there were way too many still near the garbage can considering the close proximity to where I had this hanging. Also it took a lot longer for the flies to take interest in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Renee Campbell

customer_reviews.title: They work but...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these twice. The first time, I closed it, double bagged it and bagged it again. It leaked in my car. Honest to God, if I didn't have the right trunk liner, I would have had to sell my car. Second experience not much better. Up for 3 weeks, and began leaking. If you haven't smelled one of these, you cannot imagine the degree of foul. Too much to worry about when it's time to dispose of them.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: It works, but
customer_reviews.text: Be warned, this product works, but it kinda works too well. It will attract flies from the next town over. I had both going at once in two corners of my yard away from the house , it stinks to high heaven, but both were filled with flies after only 2 or 3 days. I mean filled to the brim with no room left. I live in a city, small backyard, 2 small dogs that poop on woodchips and is promptly cleaned. The amount of flies these things caught is ridiculous. They must be flying in from all over.
customer_reviews.author: Damian A Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I hung this in my garage where we have a fly problem due to having baby kittens and the flys are all over the kitty litter box. When i read the instructions it stated, "dispose after 30 days or when it drys up". Well after about a week it started to smell horrible, yeah flies where still going into the bag but my whole garage started to smell. After 2 weeks I couldn't even get close enough to the bag without wanting to vomit. It would have been nice if you could close the bag securely so it could be thrown away without the stuff leaking out.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

product_meta.title: RESCUE! Outdoor Disposable Hanging Fly Trap – 2 Pack
product_meta.description: Color:GreyThe RESCUE! Non-Toxic Disposable Fly Trap catches common nuisance or filth flies, hundreds of the most prevalent species including house flies, false stable flies, blow flies, blue and green bottle flies, flesh flies, face flies and many others. Inside the trap is a bait that flies find irresistible. This attractant is comprised of food and feed ingredients, and other food flavorings generally recognized as safe. The attractant dissolves and activates when water is added to the bag. Lured by the scent, flies enter the trap through the yellow top cap and drown in the water. Has been proven to catch up to 20,000 flies. RESCUE!'s goal is to design, manufacture and market the safest, most effective pest control solutions available. Our products are the result of exhaustive and ongoing research and development, decades of experience and a commitment to solutions that respect the environment without sacriﬁcing results. Established in 1982, RESCUE! pest management products have never used poisons or toxicants to kill pest insects.
feature_bullets: NO-HASSLE FLY CONTROL – This 2 Pack of outdoor hanging fly traps gets rid of common nuisance or filth flies, including hundreds of the most prevalent species! Once the traps are full, simply discard—no mess!
FLIES FIND IT FAST – These traps use a water-soluble bait attractant that flies find irresistible. Lured by the scent, flies enter the trap through the yellow top cap and drown in the water.
EASY TO USE – Follow the easy directions on the bag to expose the trap entrance. Then, just add water to activate, and hang the trap outside 20 feet away from any living spaces. Dispose when full.

FOR OUTDOOR USE – Flies find the scent of our special attracting bait irresistible, but—trust us—you and your house guests will not. Only use this trap outdoors, and 20 feet away from any living areas.

MADE IN THE USA – At RESCUE, our goal is to design, manufacture, and market the safest and most effective pest control solutions available for homeowners. We are proud to manufacture our products in the USA!
